Collection of Poems

From Peragro Tempus Wiki

  • 1 Darkly

  • 5 Betrayed

Darkly

A darkly day fades to night

Ages since the world was bright

Many now see only dark

A world cold, dim and stark


I often wonder if its truly death I fear

How could it be worse than the dark I face out here?

Is a life worth living when only cold remains?

I hate it now this evil, pulsing through my veins

-Author Unknown

The Magic Book

He took the book and found a place to read

Covered in blood the book began to beat

Opening in horror it engulved him in fire and ice

Agonising pain and despair

Fright, blood and burning hair

Unable to move and slowly dying

The book had taken a grip on him

A flying axe, the light dim

Splat, scream! Or just a dream...

Battle at Vaalnor

They breached the gates with roars like screaming cattle

A fully equiped army they found ready to do battle

Blood and guts flew around

To aggression and death-lust both parties were bound

A sword through the gut and ocasionally a bashed-in head

Chopped off arms and many dead

They took the plaza, market and drawbridge wall

Though the main fortress would nay fall

A small group of children and old men made their last stand at the king's dining hall

Doing battle heroically till victorious they were all

The dead and wounded strewn about they lay

Another battle victorious, time for a new day

The Balled of Aparon

On the dawn the marchers came
A crop of spears warning of fletcher's rain.

By evn'tide the flood had come
That'd turned many fort to broken ruin.
Yet Aparon no outpost stand
But city fast on hallow'd land.

On the dawn the marchers came,
A crop of spears warns of fletcher's rain.

So city wall became the dike
To hold back sea of sword and pike.
Guardians look from watcher's wall
Brace to bear the coming squall.

On the dawn the marchers came,
A crop of spears warn of fletcher's rain.

Among the walls the generals stand
Ganor and Baltare of Aparan.
Halk and Saeda each a wall as well.
Each looks to his part of the swell.

On the dawn the marchers came,
The spear crop warns of fletcher's rain.

Each general did look to Aparon lord,
A coward who feared the coming sword.
Who quietly met with gathered horde,
And brokered his own accord.

So on the dawn the marchers came,
Betraying defenders to fletcher's rain.
Where battle elsewise would have come,
Butchers blood instead did run.

Not a man would there remain,
Nor lord who knew trator's pain,
For the invaders might would wash away,
All but the bricks on that black day.

So when the dawn shows marchers came,
And the spear crop warns of fletcher's rain.

Stand fast if lord or lowly man,
Remember the tail of Aparan.
Know that cowardace brings eternal shame
While only death comes with the fletcher's rain.

Betrayed

voice vanished forever lost traditions of the past gone to other allure values shifted in the sand a culture dies slowly with nothing to replace it the youth led by evil deceit pulled us off the edge betrayal from within once the mark of outsiders left us standing lifeless dead to the mark of denial
